qas.question: What depends on what religion is usual for the respective Slavic ethnic groups?
Other than the Roman Catholics, who else uses Latin?
What is a Latin script to write in Belarusian?
What is dependent on the alphabet?
What is the name of the latin script Muslims use?
What do most Greek Romans use?
What language uses a Cyrillic script called Lacinka?

context: Slavic standard languages which are official in at least one country: Belarusian, Bosnian, Bulgarian, Croatian, Czech, Macedonian, Montenegrin, Polish, Russian, Serbian, Slovak, Slovene, and Ukrainian. <a0_0>The alphabet<a0_0/> depends on what <b5_0>religion<b5_0/> is usual for the respective Slavic ethnic groups. <a1_0>The Orthodox<a1_0/> use the Cyrillic alphabet and <a2_0>the Roman Catholics<a2_0/> use Latin alphabet, <a3_0>the Bosniaks<a3_0/> who are Muslims also use the <b7_0>Latin<b7_0/>. Few Greek Roman and Roman Catholics use the Cyrillic alphabet however. The Serbian language and Montenegrin language uses <b8_0>both Cyrillic and Latin alphabets<b8_0/>. There is also a Latin script to write in <b9_0>Belarusian<b9_0/>, called <a4_0>the <b6_0>Lacinka<b6_0/> alphabet<a4_0/>.
